content:
• Thursday, February 16, 2012
  • BKD

    Brookdale Senior Living (NYSE:BKD): Q4 EPS of -$0.12 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $672M (+16%...

    Brookdale Senior Living (NYSE:BKD): Q4 EPS of -$0.12 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $672M (+16% Y/Y) beats by $75M. Shares -4.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:40 PM
  • T

    More on Leap Wireless (LEAP): Q4 loss narrows on fewer charges but misses estimates as its...

    More on Leap Wireless (LEAP): Q4 loss narrows on fewer charges but misses estimates as its traditionally lower-income customer base has been hit hard by high unemployment and economic weakness. It ended the period with 5.9M customers, up from 5.52M from a year earlier. Churn edged down to 3.9% from 4%. Shares -2.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:06 PM
  • WEB

    In tandem with its Q4 report, Web.com (WWWW) is filing to issue 7M new shares at an offering...

    In tandem with its Q4 report, Web.com (WWWW) is filing to issue 7M new shares at an offering price of $13.02. The company is also filing to sell 16.4M shares currently held by insiders, at the same offering price. Web.com says it may use the proceeds from the former offering to pay down debt or fund acquisitions. In spite of the offerings, shares are up 3.6% AH thanks to the company's earnings beat.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 PM | 4 Comments
  • ARUN

    Aruba Networks (NASDAQ:ARUN) guides on its FQ2 earnings call for revenue of $130M-$132M and EPS...

    Aruba Networks (NASDAQ:ARUN) guides on its FQ2 earnings call for revenue of $130M-$132M and EPS of $0.16, in-line with Street estimates of $131.2M and $0.16. That appears to be helping the maker of enterprise Wi-Fi gear pare its post-earnings losses. ARUN -2.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:21 PM
  • QLIK

    More on Qlik Technologies' Q4: In addition to missing EPS forecasts, Qlik is guiding for Q1...

    More on Qlik Technologies' Q4: In addition to missing EPS forecasts, Qlik is guiding for Q1 revenue of $76M-$78M and EPS of -$0.06 to -$0.08, below a consensus of $80.3M and $0.02. Full-year guidance is better (revenue of $405M-$415M and EPS of $0.40-$0.44 vs. consensus of $399.9M and $0.43). Qlik blames the soft Q1 forecast on seasonality and higher personnel expenses. QLIK -7.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:08 PM
  • TEU

    Box Ships (NYSE:TEU): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $16.5M (-79% Y/Y) misses by...

    Box Ships (NYSE:TEU): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $16.5M (-79% Y/Y) misses by $23M. Shares +2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM
  • SPWR

    More on SunPower's Q4: Earnings beat driven by a 100 bps Q/Q increase in gross margin to 12.4%,...

    More on SunPower's Q4: Earnings beat driven by a 100 bps Q/Q increase in gross margin to 12.4%, breaking a string of declines. SunPower is guiding for Q1 revenue of $500M-$575M and EPS of -$0.20 to -$0.05 (consensus of $610.3M and -$0.11), and 2012 revenue of $2.6B and EPS of breakeven or better (consensus of $2.72B and $0.28). In the current environment, that's good enough for a rally. SPWR +12.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • CVI

    Just days after pushing for a sale, Carl Icahn today announced a tender offer for all...

    Just days after pushing for a sale, Carl Icahn today announced a tender offer for all outstanding shares of CVR Energy (CVI +5.8%) at $30 each, a 35% premium to the Jan. 12 close, when he first took a stake. The offer includes a "contingent value right" that would entitle shareholders to an additional payment if CVR is eventually sold for more than $30/share. (CVR response)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM

    RealPage (NASDAQ:RP): Q4 EPS of $0.10 in-line. Revenue of $71.3M (+31.4% Y/Y) misses by $2.7M....

    Rogers (NYSE:ROG): Q4 EPS of $0.22 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.29. Revenue of...

    Rogers (NYSE:ROG): Q4 EPS of $0.22 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.29. Revenue of $126.4M (+29.9% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • MSFT

    More on Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT): Bill Gates' divesting of shares necessitates the re-weighting,...

    More on Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT): Bill Gates' divesting of shares necessitates the re-weighting, according to Morgan's Adam Holt. S&P calculations exclude shares held by insiders totaling over 10%. Once Gates' holdings drop below that level, his shares become part of the float, making an increased weighting necessary.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • MXWL

    Maxwell Technologies (NASDAQ:MXWL): Q4 EPS of $0.07 in-line. Revenue of $42.5M (+24.1% Y/Y)...

    Maxwell Technologies (NASDAQ:MXWL): Q4 EPS of $0.07 in-line. Revenue of $42.5M (+24.1% Y/Y) misses by $0.5M. Shares -3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • MSFT

    Microsoft's (NASDAQ:MSFT) weighting in the S&P 500 will likely be increased, Morgan...

    Microsoft's (NASDAQ:MSFT) weighting in the S&P 500 will likely be increased, Morgan Stanley's Adam Holt has told clients, according to Bloomberg's Dina Bass. He expects the change - which would force index funds to up their holdings of Mister Softee - to take place in the fall. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • BIDU

    More on Baidu's Q4: The company expects Q1 revenue of $666.5M-$688M, in-line with a consensus of...

    More on Baidu's Q4: The company expects Q1 revenue of $666.5M-$688M, in-line with a consensus of $678.5M. Traffic acquisition costs made up 7.9% of revenue, down slightly Q/Q. Baidu's ad customer base rose just 2.3% Q/Q and 12.7% Y/Y to 311K. However, its revenue per customer rose 5.1% Q/Q and 61.8% Y/Y. Operating expense growth, while high, trailed revenue growth. BIDU +3.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • MDRX

    More on Allscripts-Misys Healthcare Solutions (NASDAQ:MDRX): reports an in-line Q4 on higher Y/Y...

    More on Allscripts-Misys Healthcare Solutions (NASDAQ:MDRX): reports an in-line Q4 on higher Y/Y profit due to prior-year charges related to its acquisition of Eclipsys Corp. Shares are lower in after-hours trading however as the company gave a cautious view for the current quarter, projecting earnings of $1.06 - $1.10. Analysts were expecting $1.10. Shares -4.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM

    Demand Media (DMD): Q4 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $84.4M (+14.7% Y/Y) beats by $3M....

    More on DaVita (NYSE:DVA): Operating cash flow $151M in Q4, $1.18B in 2011. Free cash flow $32M in Q4, $151M in 2011. Guidance for 2012 has operating income at $1.2-1.3B, operating cash flow $950M-$1.05B.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM

  • AMAT

    More on Applied Materials' FQ1: The company expects FQ2 sales of $2.3B-$2.52B and EPS of...

    More on Applied Materials' FQ1: The company expects FQ2 sales of $2.3B-$2.52B and EPS of $0.20-$0.28, better than Street estimates of $2.08B and $0.16. After falling hard in recent quarters, chip equipment orders rose 53% Q/Q, boosted by foundry demand and the acquisition of Varian. However, total backlog fell by $230M to $2.2B, due to continued weakness in display and solar equipment orders. AMAT +4.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 1 Comment

    Qlik Technologies (NASDAQ:QLIK): Q4 EPS of $0.23 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $108.1M (+32.8%...

    | 4:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • JWN

    More on Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q4 comes in relatively in line on strong sales in its high-end...

    More on Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q4 comes in relatively in line on strong sales in its high-end designer lines. The shares are dipping in the post session however, after forecasting a weak profit range for the current year, calling for earnings between $3.30 - $3.45 per share. Analysts' projections are for $3.59. Shares -2.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM

    Allscripts-Misys Healthcare Solutions (NASDAQ:MDRX): Q4 EPS of $0.25 in-line. Revenue of $388M...

  • MSFT

    Possibly helping Microsoft (MSFT +4.1%) make multi-year highs today are remarks from CFO Peter...

    Possibly helping Microsoft (MSFT +4.1%) make multi-year highs today are remarks from CFO Peter Klein at a Goldman conference (.doc). Klein suggested Microsoft might boost its dividend (current yield of 2.6%) should the tax situation for offshore cash change. He also claimed it will eventually be possible for older Windows apps to be rewritten for ARM-based (NASDAQ:ARMH) systems - a point of concern for developers.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • CLD

    Cloud Peak Energy (NYSE:CLD): Q4 EPS of $0.70 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $402M (+16.4% Y/Y)...

  • PHM

    PulteGroup (PHM -2%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy by UBS, which notes shares have climbed...

    PulteGroup (PHM -2%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy by UBS, which notes shares have climbed 129% since September, well ahead of other home builders and the S&P 500; the stock now trades at 1.5x current book value. Although PHM is making strides in efforts to narrow relative underperformance, UBS believes upside is limited from current levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • CRAI

    Consulting firm CRA International (CRAI +21.8%) jumps after its Q4 easily beat estimates on...

    Consulting firm CRA International (CRAI +21.8%) jumps after its Q4 easily beat estimates on strong profit from its litigation business. The company also took an upbeat view for its new fiscal year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • TVTY

    Healthways (HWAY -10%) takes a hit after its Q4 misses estimates across the board. Net profits...

    Healthways (HWAY -10%) takes a hit after its Q4 misses estimates across the board. Net profits rose marginally Y/Y, but not enough to offset a steep drop in the health-care provider's market capitalization, which forced it to write down some of its value.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • IPI

    Intrepid Potash (IPI +4.8%) moves up despite posting a mixed Q4. Revenue rose 8.7% Y/Y as the...

    Intrepid Potash (IPI +4.8%) moves up despite posting a mixed Q4. Revenue rose 8.7% Y/Y as the minerals producer saw higher langbeinite and potash per-ton sales prices contribute to stronger overall sales numbers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • HOS

    Hornbeck Offshore Services (HOS +7.4%) ramps up after blowing out Q4 EPS estimates this morning....

    Hornbeck Offshore Services (HOS +7.4%) ramps up after blowing out Q4 EPS estimates this morning. Revenue jumped over 26% Y/Y on heavy demand. Dayrates rose modestly, but results were driven by the start of a long-term contract in Brazil during the summer. The company adds that strong cash flow from the project is anticipated to continue.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • WM

    Waste Management (WM -1.9%) trades lower after posting a mixed Q4 earlier today. Earnings fell...

    Waste Management (WM -1.9%) trades lower after posting a mixed Q4 earlier today. Earnings fell 5.3% Y/Y amid higher charges though the waste-disposal company saw higher revenue. The company also issued a cautious full-year earnings estimate, now seeing its EPS towards the low-end of estimates at $2.22 - $2.30 per share. The Street is at $2.29.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • VVUS

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS -9.1%) fall into an afternoon swoon after being in positive territory...

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS -9.1%) fall into an afternoon swoon after being in positive territory earlier in the day. Chatter that the FDA might require a large cardiovascular safety study of Qnexa before approving it seems to be the culprit behind the downswing.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • NTAP

    Several research firms raise price targets (I, II, III, IV) for NetApp (NTAP +7%) after FQ3...

    Several research firms raise price targets (I, II, III, IV) for NetApp (NTAP +7%) after FQ3 results and the outlook for coming quarters calm investors worried that growth at the data storage company has slowed. Janney says the quarter showed signs of momentum, higher sales of pricey products and a recovery in landing major accounts.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • PCAR

    Paccar (PCAR +4.5%) trades higher after Scania's (OTCPK:SVKBY) CEO said yesterday that the...

    Paccar (PCAR +4.5%) trades higher after Scania's (OTCPK:SVKBY) CEO said yesterday that the European truck market has bottomed out. Europe's struggling truck market has been weighing on Paccar, which slashed 2012 European sales forecasts two weeks ago. Its DAF truck brand is a major player in the European market, and more than one-third of its 2011 sales came from Europe .
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • BAC

    Financial stocks (XLF +1.3%) rally to the head of the pack among S&P sectors after an early...

    Financial stocks (XLF +1.3%) rally to the head of the pack among S&P sectors after an early slump following Moody’s warning that it could make severe cuts to the ratings of big banks. Hopeful news out of Greece and strong U.S. data are taking priority; and hey, that's just one guy's opinion. BAC +4%, C +2.9%, JPM +1.5%, GS +1.2%, MS +0.8%, RY +0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • STFC

    State Auto Financial (STFC +18.4%) moves up after beating Q4 estimates earlier today. Earnings...

    State Auto Financial (STFC +18.4%) moves up after beating Q4 estimates earlier today. Earnings rose 12.4% Y/Y on stronger-than-expected profit as the regional property-and-casualty insurer's combined ratio improved. Core underwriting results, excluding the impact of catastrophes, were essentially flat compared with a year ago.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • MSI

    Motorola Solutions (MSI +2.2%) gets tagged as a 30-day Research Tactical Idea by Morgan Stanley....

    Motorola Solutions (MSI +2.2%) gets tagged as a 30-day Research Tactical Idea by Morgan Stanley. Analysts say that the firm could benefit from a provision in the payroll tax cut that relates to funding for state LTE projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • SYNT

    IT outsourcing firm Syntel (SYNT +17.9%) takes off after delivering a strong Q4 beat, which is...

    IT outsourcing firm Syntel (SYNT +17.9%) takes off after delivering a strong Q4 beat, which is going over well with investors put on edge by soft guidance (I, II) from rivals INFY and CTSH. A 230 bps Q/Q gross margin increase helped boost earnings. For 2012, Syntel says it expects revenue of $720M-$750M and EPS of $3.10-$3.35, which compares with a consensus of $735M and $3.31.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • OC

    Barclays says Owens Corning's (OC +1.9%) weak Q4 results yesterday creates a buying opportunity...

    Barclays says Owens Corning's (OC +1.9%) weak Q4 results yesterday creates a buying opportunity in the name, given the signs of growth in its key product lines and the building products supplier's exposure to a U.S. housing recovery.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • TNGO

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO +6.6%) jumps after reporting Q4 revenue of $29.2M (+57% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.08,...

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO +6.6%) jumps after reporting Q4 revenue of $29.2M (+57% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.08, beating Street estimates by $1.1M and $0.01. The maker of communications asset management software is guiding for Q1 revenue of $32.M-$32.7M and EPS of $0.08 (consensus of $31.6M and $0.08), and 2012 revenue of $137M-$139M and EPS of $0.41-$0.42 (consensus of $135.5M and $0.41).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • COO

    Cooper Companies (COO +4%) gets a boost after JP Morgan raises estimates ahead of its Q1 results...

    Cooper Companies (COO +4%) gets a boost after JP Morgan raises estimates ahead of its Q1 results in March and sees a near-term trading opportunity in the name.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • UPL

    Ultra Petroleum (UPL -4.4%) trades lower after the firm misses with its Q4 earnings report and...

    Ultra Petroleum (UPL -4.4%) trades lower after the firm misses with its Q4 earnings report and revises its production growth guidance down to a range of 4%-6% from 16% on pressure stirred up by lower natural gas prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • HALO

    Halozyme (HALO +3%) gets a boost from positive comments out of JMP Securities today. The firm...

    Halozyme (HALO +3%) gets a boost from positive comments out of JMP Securities today. The firm says the drug developer's SC Cinryze treatment and its aesthetic medicine candidate HTI-501 are both undergoing Phase II tests, and are likely to drive the stock higher in 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +2.8%), off yesterday after introducing its Vue brewer, is...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +2.8%), off yesterday after introducing its Vue brewer, is rebounding today on an upgrade to Buy from Dougherty. The firm believes the in-line FY12 guidance that accompanied Green Mountain's FQ1 beat was the result of the difficulty in predicting future K-Cup shipments following a recent surge in brewer sales, and that the strength in brewer sales could drive upside.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • EXPD

    Expeditors (EXPD +4.2%) trades higher as Jefferies ups the shares to Buy on valuation, citing a...

    Expeditors (EXPD +4.2%) trades higher as Jefferies ups the shares to Buy on valuation, citing a bottoming in Asian airfreight demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • STRA

    Strayer Education (STRA -11%) gets hammered despite beating slightly on its Q4 results, as...

    Strayer Education (STRA -11%) gets hammered despite beating slightly on its Q4 results, as investors focus on downbeat FQ1 EPS projections that miss Street expectations. It now forecasts Q1 earnings of $2.07 - $2.09 per share, well below analysts' estimates of $2.24 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • MSFT

    It's a multi-year breakout for Microsoft (MSFT +3.7%), trading at $31.19, its highest price...

    It's a multi-year breakout for Microsoft (MSFT +3.7%), trading at $31.19, its highest price going back to February 2008. The next stop on the charts is the $37 area, representing a 10-year high for the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • PLX

    Protalix BioTherapeutics (PLX -10.6%) says its sale of 4.5M shares priced at $5.25 per share, a...

    Protalix BioTherapeutics (PLX -10.6%) says its sale of 4.5M shares priced at $5.25 per share, a 14% discount to yesterday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • BBW

    Build-A-Bear Workshop (BBW -23.1%) CEO Maxine Clark tries to explain away the firm's lackluster...

    Build-A-Bear Workshop (BBW -23.1%) CEO Maxine Clark tries to explain away the firm's lackluster Q4 performance in an earnings CC. She says a slow holiday season at theaters depressed the anticipated sales for products with tie-ins to current releases - forcing the company to step up promotions and discounting.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 3 Comments
  • SJM

    J.M. Smucker (SJM -9.6%) shares sink after FQ3 earnings fell 11% on a greater-than-expected drop...

    J.M. Smucker (SJM -9.6%) shares sink after FQ3 earnings fell 11% on a greater-than-expected drop in sales volume, and weak 2012 guidance. "SJM is yet another company to point out lower consumer demand across the food industry," J.P. Morgan warns, a negative for grocers and food manufacturers "as consumers are no longer accepting higher retail prices."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 3 Comments
  • NVDA

    Having initially sold off due to its soft FQ1 guidance, Nvidia (NVDA +1%) has reversed course....

    Having initially sold off due to its soft FQ1 guidance, Nvidia (NVDA +1%) has reversed course. The move comes in spite of a downgrade to Below Average from Caris, which is concerned about Nvidia's declining gross margin, partly the result of yield issues for 28nm chips. But Needham is staying bullish on expectations of strong Tegra adoption in smartphones, and eventually Windows 8 hardware. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
